article.title: Agency Seeking Advanced Input
article.author: Maryann Lawlor
article.abstract: The National Cybersecurity Center of Excellence (NCCoE) is seeking comments on a request for proposals partial draft in preparation for contracting a company to operate a Federally Funded Research and Development Center (FFRDC) that will focus solely on securing U.S. information systems.
article.text: The National Cybersecurity Center of Excellence (NCCoE) is seeking comments on a request for proposals partial draft in preparation for contracting a company to operate a Federally Funded Research and Development Center (FFRDC) that will focus solely on securing U.S. information systems. The plan is to award a single indefinite delivery/indefinite quantity contract with firm fixed price, labor hour or cost reimbursement task orders. Currently, the proposed base period for the maximum $400 million contract is five years. A federal staff will provide overall management of the center. Three major task areas have been identified: reach, development, engineering and technical support; program/project management; and facilities management. The NCCoE operates under the Information Technology Laboratory of the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST), which is holding an industry day on January 8.
